name: EA-010-Bergson
description:
Henri Bergson (1859 -1941 aC) was a French philosopher and diplomat, awarded the 1927 Nobel Prize for Literature. Known mainly for Essays on the Immediate Data of Consciousness, Matter and Memory, Creative Evolution and The Two Sources of Moral and Religion, his work is from very current and has been studied in different disciplines - cinema, literature, neuropsychology, bioethics, among others.

Digital Watercolor Vector Illustration made in Adobe Photoshop, 1200x1200px, 200dpi, JPEG
